page.title: 10LYMES FARM BUTTERTON VILLAGE
page.content: This 300 acre farm has been in the Matthews family since 1898 when it was much larger.Acreage:Winter barley 40 & spring barley 30(cattle feed),grass 42 (silage) & woodland 20.The rest is for grazing.The 300 beef cattle include Charolais,Limousin,Simmental,Galbaver & Hereford/Friesian which are sold for slaughter at Newcastle or Crewe markets.They have 178 ewes,5 rams & 300 lambs,mainly Suffolk,Texel,Mule Kerry & Clun.The wildlife is deer & badger in the woods & pheasants.Some birds are bred.Water comes from springs & streams except 3 troughs, mains fed.The whole family helps on the farm & one employee who comes from Westlands who works 40 hours a week(60 at harvest).An acre is worth 2,000 pounds,a tractor 14,000,a plough 1,600, a bailer 4,500,and the whole farm may be worth 750,000 pounds.
